1: <sup>1</sup> O LORD my God, in thee do I put my trust: save me from all them that persecute me, and deliver me:
2: <sup>2</sup> Lest he tear my soul like a lion, rending it in pieces, while there is none to deliver.
3: <sup>3</sup> O LORD my God, If I have done this; if there be iniquity in my hands;
4: <sup>4</sup> If I have rewarded evil unto him that was at peace with me; (yea, I have delivered him that without cause is mine enemy:)
5: <sup>5</sup> Let the enemy persecute my soul, and take it; yea, let him tread down my life upon the earth, and lay mine honour in the dust. Selah.
6: <sup>6</sup> Arise, O LORD, in thine anger, lift up thyself because of the rage of mine enemies: and awake for me to the judgment that thou hast commanded.
7: <sup>7</sup> So shall the congregation of the people compass thee about: for their sakes therefore return thou on high.
8: <sup>8</sup> The LORD shall judge the people: judge me, O LORD, according to my righteousness, and according to mine integrity that is in me.
9: <sup>9</sup> Oh let the wickedness of the wicked come to an end; but establish the just: for the righteous God trieth the hearts and reins.
10: <sup>10</sup> My defence is of God, which saveth the upright in heart.
11: <sup>11</sup> God judgeth the righteous, and God is angry with the wicked every day.
12: <sup>12</sup> If he turn not, he will whet his sword; he hath bent his bow, and made it ready.
13: <sup>13</sup> He hath also prepared for him the instruments of death; he ordaineth his arrows against the persecutors.
14: <sup>14</sup> Behold, he travaileth with iniquity, and hath conceived mischief, and brought forth falsehood.
15: <sup>15</sup> He made a pit, and digged it, and is fallen into the ditch which he made.
16: <sup>16</sup> His mischief shall return upon his own head, and his violent dealing shall come down upon his own pate.
17: <sup>17</sup> I will praise the LORD according to his righteousness: and will sing praise to the name of the LORD most high.
